title: (x) ID a font / Opening credits of 'Medium', CBS TV program - Tempus Sans, Papyrus {Riccardo, Lex, Florian}
content:
I am looking for the name of the font on the opening credits of the TV program "Medium", broadcast in the US. I've tried to get a sample, but for some reason I can not create a registered account on CBS web site. Other attempts to get a sample, are from countries other then the US and the font a different. The font in question appears to be Celtic, with dropped caps. Can anyone help??

g

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [From-Medium.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102044528/http:/typophile.com/files/From-Medium.jpg) | 41.27 KB |
author: mrbeavis

comments.content:
<cite>The font in question appears to be Celtic</cite>

It's this?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102044528im_/http:/typophile.com/files/CBS_MEDIUM_611_CLIP4_3830.png)

Looks like a stroked and squooshed Tempus Sans.

- Lex

R

Thanks so much for the effort. But I can only compare your sample, and the font in question, with upper & lower case. The cap's drop below the baseline. Your sample does have similarities. The cap "D", in the screen credits is very distinctive. Celtic, most likely But calligraphy/brush stroke characteristics. What is the font you presented???

Again thinks for your help

gary

Has anyone found a sample of the original font. I keep trying to download trailer & opening credit of the program with no luck.

Lex thanks for joining in, to ID this beautiful letterform

g

Am I chasing something that is proprietary? Designed only for the TV program????

g
If Tempus Sans is the font is there a site for free download?????

If Tempus Sans is the font is there a site for free download?????
 Short answer: No!!!!!

No, it’s a commercial font; you need to [license it](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102044528/http:/www.itcfonts.com/fonts/font/pid/204055/ITC+Tempus+Sans+Package/detail&grab_id=0&page_id=117337&query=tempus). Read about [the value of type](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102044528/http:/www.letterror.com/content/value/index.html).

Thanks to all that helped me ID this font.

Rock-on, mates, & watch F1 this summer.  
g

\> you need to license it

Tempus Sans ships with MS Office ('97 ff.) Maybe Mr. Beavis is one of the 52.7 percent¹ of computer users who already have it installed or on their Office install disk. In which case he doesn't need to.

¹ Wild but educated guess

Fontgrube, sorry to inform you. I'm a MAC used. On rare occasions I will boot "Windows". But the frustration make me want to pull my hair out. Guess that's a factor in my baldness

Also, concerning the font in question, I have come to the conclusion that it is not Tempus Sans. I captured an image of the font off a DVD and while there are a few similarities I have to continue looking. Is there a way to include Jpg file in my post. I'll include my email address if anyone is interested in continue the search. I can atleast reply with the image.  
Link to show [http://www.cbs.com/primetime/medium/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102044528/http:/www.cbs.com/primetime/medium/ "http://www.cbs.com/primetime/medium/")

Cherrio

[formula1.unitedstates@gmail.com](mailto:formula1.unitedstates@gmail.com)

<cite>Is there a way to include Jpg file in my post</cite>

Yes: [How to post a sample or image](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102044528/http:/typophile.com/node/18067)  
Make sure that:

- the file name does not contain spaces (or any other ø∂∂ ¢håræct€rs)
- you have the right [Flash plugin](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102044528/http:/www.adobe.com/products/flashplayer/) installed with your browser

Your link doesn’t work for me: “not available for your geographic region”

@Andreas (Fontgrube):  
<cite>In which case he doesn't need to</cite>

Rather: In which case he already has licensed it, and doesn’t need to license it again.  
;-)

Cheers,  
F

Alright, that is some version of the infamous [Papyrus](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102044528/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/papyrus/?testdrive=dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D87%26w%3D600%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DCo-Executive%2520Producer%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%26seed%3D24)!

[Elsner+Flake’s cut](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102044528/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/papyrus/?testdrive=dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D87%26w%3D600%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DCo-Executive%2520Producer%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%26seed%3D18) has the large lowered caps, but no cigar … Close enough for you?

<cite>Celtic, most likely But calligraphy/brush stroke characteristics.</cite>

<cite>that is some version of the infamous Papyrus!</cite>

I had a feeling it would be it…
